moves.1. d4 g6 2. e4 Bg7: Bisguier forms a classical center: Larsen prefers a flank attack.
moves.3. f4 d6 4. Nf3 Nf6: The first stab at the domineering central Pawns.
moves.5. Bd3: Both players have now cleared the way for castling.
moves.6... Nbd7 7. e5: Trying to seize command of the game.
moves.7... Ne8: Larsen's position is getiing dangerously cramped. He must find a way to either gain space or exchange some pieces.
moves.8. Qe1 c6 9. f5: Bisguier presses forward on the K-side.
moves.9... dxe5 10. fxg6 hxg6: Opening an avenue of attack for Bisguier on the KR file.
moves.11. Qh4: Bisguier wastes no time seizing it.
moves.11... exd4: At least he has the consolation of grabbing some material.
moves.12... Nef6 13. Ng5: The attack gains strength every move.
moves.14... Bh8 15. Rf1 Re8: Attempting to create flight squares for the King.
moves.16. Bf8: If Larsen takes the Bishop, it is mate on the move.
moves.17... exf6: He may as well take. If he doesn't recapture, White simply retreats the Rook and even if a checkmate isn't forced immediately Bisguier has a winning material advantage.
